newsitem.title: USA: Network Six gets loan to run operations.
newsitem.headline: Network Six gets loan to run operations.

text.p: Network Six Inc has obtained a $1.8 million term loan from its bank in order to finance its operations through January 31, 1998.
A company spokeswoman said Network renegotiated its line of credit with the bank every year. Its previous loan was worth $2.1 million, she said.

Network, a systems integrator for state health and human service agencies, also reported a loss of $0.24 a share on revenues of $1.4 million for the first quarter against a profit of $0.26 on $3.7 million a year ago.
It blamed lower earnings on lower revenues and higher administrative expenses as a percentage of revenues.
It said revenues were lower because it had completed a number of contracts.
Network said it had signed a systems development contract with the state of Maine during the quarter.
